# GitHub Issue Templates

This directory contains templates for creating issues in this repository.

## Available Templates

### 1. Bug Report (`bug_report.md`)
Use this template when you've found a bug or unexpected behavior in the application.

**When to use:**
- The application crashes or shows errors
- Features don't work as documented
- Visual glitches or UI problems
- Performance issues

### 2. Feature Request (`feature_request.md`)
Use this template to suggest new features or enhancements.

**When to use:**
- You have an idea for a new feature
- You want to improve existing functionality
- You'd like to see better documentation
- You want to suggest architectural improvements

### 3. Enhanced Logging Feature (`enhanced_logging_feature.md`)
A pre-filled template specifically for the logging feature enhancement proposal.

**When to use:**
- You want to contribute to the logging enhancement project
- You have feedback on the proposed logging improvements
- You want to implement one of the phases described

## How to Use

When creating a new issue:

1. Click "New Issue" in the Issues tab
2. Select the appropriate template
3. Fill in all required sections
4. Add relevant labels
5. Submit the issue

## Template Structure

All templates follow this general structure:

```yaml
---
name: Template Name
about: Brief description
title: '[PREFIX] '
labels: label1, label2
assignees: ''
---
```

## Custom Templates

If none of the existing templates fit your needs, you can:
1. Create a blank issue
2. Provide as much detail as possible
3. Use the feature request template as a general guide

## Configuration

The `config.yml` file configures:
- Whether blank issues are allowed
- External links for support/discussions
- Additional resources

## Contributing

When adding new templates:
1. Follow the existing YAML frontmatter format
2. Use clear, descriptive names
3. Include helpful placeholder text
4. Add appropriate labels
5. Update this README
